result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Voight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with probation in Walworth County file 22CF234.
**AMENDED ON 10/27/22 TO REFLECT 59 DAYS OF DEADTIME CREDIT IF REVOKED.**

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.
----------------------

No weapons, firearms, facsimile firearms, or ammunition.
----------------------

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol, drugs (other than prescribed), or paraphernalia. Not to be in any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or places whose primary purpose is the sale/distribution of alcohol. No contact with the victim, R.F. without victim's and Agent's consent.
----------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
----------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $2,189.13 to the victim, Bloomfield Police Department, and restitution surcharges. **NOTE:  $500.00 in bond money has been applied toward the restitution and will be disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Court's office.
----------------------

Defendant Matthew S. Voight in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Total bond set to cover all cases with $2000 cash component. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

BOND TO COVER 22GF1023, 22CF530, 22CF411, 22CF234, 21CF111, 22CF232, & 22CF311

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. Contact with victim as permitted in 22CV177. Defendant may contact victim through phone calls or text messages while defendant is in custody. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.F. (dob 1/6/1982) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

3:20 PM (64-06)  Defendant Matthew S. Voight appeared by video.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Matthew S. Voight.  Attorney Viven TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Spear acknowledged that the Information will match the complaint. Waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Motion Hearing to amend bond.
Argument by Attorney Spear.
ADA TenHaken objects and states reasons on the record.
Evaluation is scheduled for August 15th.
NGI plea is also entered on this case.
Court will amend the bond to $2500.00 signature, $500.00 Cash (already posted) Same conditions. Defendant must make all appointment with DHHS and attend his evaluation on 08/15/2022.
